name: Flats & Backcountry Fishing
description:
Flats fishing trips are usually 4 hours long (a half day) and are dependent on the guests’ and captains’ choices of the day. These backcountry excursions are generally on smaller boats, so 1 or 2 guests is perfect. Most captains will offer spinning rods or fly fishing options as well. Can you imagine a 100lb Tarpon on a fly rod! It happens around here! Tarpon, bonefish and permit are commonly the game fish in the backcountry, and it's a well known fact that many keys fishing records are held by boats leaving from this marina. Getting out into the backcountry is a remarkable experience, wonderful for the fishing novice to expert, with incredible scenery, and the opportunity to get a shot at a trophy fish year round. 

DNA Sportfishing
Climb aboard DNA Sportfishing's 24' Yellowfin bay boat with Captain Dave Irwin and experience the best light tackle backcountry sportfishing Key West has to offer.  Explore the shallow waters and channel systems in the backcountry islands for all sorts of species, including tarpon, cobia, grouper and snapper.

Call 786-862-6203 or email concierge@oceansedgekeywest.com to book now.

ReelEasy
Fish with the Captain John Jackson, the best and most productive backcountry fishing guide in the Florida keys. with over 30 years of fishing and diving experience in the florida keys and 22 years as a professional guide.

Call 786-862-6303 or email concierge@oceansedgekeywest.com to book now.

Grey Ghost
Captain Jared Cyr is one of the truly exceptional shallow water guides here at KWPG. Jared's knowledge of the 'skinny' waters here in the backcountry of Key West is unequalled. Capt. Jared is first call with many of the best outfits here in Key West. With Jared, the day is all about what you want to fish for. Capt. Jared shows that patience needed for the beginner and the expertise for the accomplished fly or spin angler. 

Call 786-862-6303 or email concierge@oceansedgekeywest.com to book now.
